title: Love Island's Tommy Fury says he wants eight kids with Molly-Mae Hague
text:
Molly-Mae and Tommy answered fan questions in a YouTube video (Picture: YouTube) (Picture: Rex/Getty Images)

Love Island’s Molly-Mae Hague and Tommy Fury have revealed they are already trying for children – with the boxer admitting that he would like eight.

The two reality stars recently uploaded a video to Molly-Mae’s YouTube channel, as they prepared to answer fan questions while enjoying a cheeky Nando’s meal.

And one particular fan wanted to know if the two were planning on having children in the future.

‘Do you want children, and if so, how many?’ the fan asked.

‘We both definitely want children,’ Molly-Mae responded. ‘But obviously we’re both only 20 years old.’

However, Tommy objects to his beau’s reply, as he joked that they have been trying to get her pregnant for sometime now, while admitting that he wants twins ‘by the time he’s 22’.

‘We’ve been trying to make children most nights,’ he replied.

‘We’ve been [snuggling] in the bedroom, I want twins by the time I’m 22, simple as that.

However, Molly-Mae rebutted his claims, telling viewers that this was all ‘false information’, as she later admits that her desired number of kids is two.

‘I ideally want two children, but you want a big family, don’t you?’ she says to Tommy.

‘I want four, I reckon you could squeeze four in,’ he responds, as Molly-Mae laughs to the camera.

The couple were also quizzed by fans on what their biggest argument was, with Molly-Mae revealing that the couple have not actually had any squabbles together.

‘This is the weirdest thing, because I wouldn’t say that I am an argumentative person, but I can be quite grouchy sometimes, or hormonal, or when I’m hungry I’ll be really aggy, but we just don’t argue,’ she said.

‘We just constantly laugh. I’m not even just saying this to be like, oh we’re the perfect couple, because we’re not, but we just don’t argue, do we?’
